messages.content: You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Fe12N5 crystallizes in the trigonal P-31m space group. There are three inequivalent Fe sites. In the first Fe site, Fe(1) is bonded in a bent 120 degrees geometry to one N(1) and one N(2) atom. The Fe(1)-N(1) bond length is 1.89 Å. The Fe(1)-N(2) bond length is 1.92 Å. In the second Fe site, Fe(2) is bonded in a distorted T-shaped geometry to one N(3) and two equivalent N(1) atoms. The Fe(2)-N(3) bond length is 1.91 Å. Both Fe(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.95 Å. In the third Fe site, Fe(3) is bonded in a distorted trigonal planar geometry to one N(2) and two equivalent N(1) atoms. The Fe(3)-N(2) bond length is 1.89 Å. Both Fe(3)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.90 Å. There are three inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(3) is bonded to six equivalent Fe(2) atoms to form corner-sharing NFe6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 48°. In the second N site, N(1) is bonded to two equivalent Fe(1), two equivalent Fe(2), and two equivalent Fe(3) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NFe6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 48-51°. In the third N site, N(2) is bonded to two equivalent Fe(3) and four equivalent Fe(1) atoms to form corner-sharing NFe6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 50-51°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.158987435882352 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Fe24N11 crystallizes in the monoclinic C2/c space group. There are twelve inequivalent Fe sites. In the first Fe site, Fe(1) is bonded in a distorted trigonal planar geometry to one N(2), one N(3), and one N(6) atom. The Fe(1)-N(2) bond length is 1.95 Å. The Fe(1)-N(3) bond length is 1.90 Å. The Fe(1)-N(6) bond length is 1.89 Å. In the second Fe site, Fe(2) is bonded in a distorted trigonal planar geometry to one N(1), one N(3), and one N(6) atom. The Fe(2)-N(1) bond length is 1.89 Å. The Fe(2)-N(3) bond length is 1.96 Å. The Fe(2)-N(6) bond length is 1.87 Å. In the third Fe site, Fe(3) is bonded in a distorted trigonal planar geometry to one N(1), one N(2), and one N(5) atom. The Fe(3)-N(1) bond length is 1.93 Å. The Fe(3)-N(2) bond length is 1.90 Å. The Fe(3)-N(5) bond length is 1.87 Å. In the fourth Fe site, Fe(4) is bonded in a distorted trigonal planar geometry to one N(3), one N(4), and one N(5) atom. The Fe(4)-N(3) bond length is 1.87 Å. The Fe(4)-N(4) bond length is 1.95 Å. The Fe(4)-N(5) bond length is 1.90 Å. In the fifth Fe site, Fe(5) is bonded in a distorted trigonal planar geometry to one N(1), one N(4), and one N(5) atom. The Fe(5)-N(1) bond length is 1.87 Å. The Fe(5)-N(4) bond length is 1.92 Å. The Fe(5)-N(5) bond length is 1.96 Å. In the sixth Fe site, Fe(6) is bonded in a 3-coordinate geometry to one N(2), one N(4), and one N(6) atom. The Fe(6)-N(2) bond length is 1.88 Å. The Fe(6)-N(4) bond length is 1.97 Å. The Fe(6)-N(6) bond length is 1.96 Å. In the seventh Fe site, Fe(7) is bonded in a distorted bent 120 degrees geometry to one N(2) and one N(6) atom. The Fe(7)-N(2) bond length is 1.90 Å. The Fe(7)-N(6) bond length is 1.93 Å. In the eighth Fe site, Fe(8) is bonded in a bent 120 degrees geometry to one N(1) and one N(6) atom. The Fe(8)-N(1) bond length is 1.89 Å. The Fe(8)-N(6) bond length is 1.89 Å. In the ninth Fe site, Fe(9) is bonded in a distorted trigonal planar geometry to one N(3), one N(4), and one N(6) atom. The Fe(9)-N(3) bond length is 1.86 Å. The Fe(9)-N(4) bond length is 1.90 Å. The Fe(9)-N(6) bond length is 1.93 Å. In the tenth Fe site, Fe(10) is bonded in a distorted trigonal planar geometry to one N(1), one N(2), and one N(4) atom. The Fe(10)-N(1) bond length is 1.92 Å. The Fe(10)-N(2) bond length is 1.94 Å. The Fe(10)-N(4) bond length is 1.87 Å. In the eleventh Fe site, Fe(11) is bonded in a 3-coordinate geometry to one N(2), one N(3), and one N(4) atom. The Fe(11)-N(2) bond length is 1.91 Å. The Fe(11)-N(3) bond length is 1.96 Å. The Fe(11)-N(4) bond length is 1.86 Å. In the twelfth Fe site, Fe(12) is bonded in an L-shaped geometry to one N(1) and one N(3) atom. The Fe(12)-N(1) bond length is 2.01 Å. The Fe(12)-N(3) bond length is 1.97 Å. There are six inequivalent N sites. In the first N site, N(1) is bonded to one Fe(10), one Fe(12), one Fe(2), one Fe(3), one Fe(5), and one Fe(8) atom to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NFe6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 48-52°. In the second N site, N(2) is bonded to one Fe(1), one Fe(10), one Fe(11), one Fe(3), one Fe(6), and one Fe(7) atom to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NFe6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 48-50°. In the third N site, N(3) is bonded to one Fe(1), one Fe(11), one Fe(12), one Fe(2), one Fe(4), and one Fe(9) atom to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NFe6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 47-51°. In the fourth N site, N(6) is bonded to one Fe(1), one Fe(2), one Fe(6), one Fe(7), one Fe(8), and one Fe(9) atom to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NFe6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 47-52°. In the fifth N site, N(4) is bonded to one Fe(10), one Fe(11), one Fe(4), one Fe(5), one Fe(6), and one Fe(9) atom to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NFe6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 48-52°. In the sixth N site, N(5) is bonded to two equivalent Fe(3), two equivalent Fe(4), and two equivalent Fe(5) atoms to form a mixture of edge and corner-sharing NFe6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles range from 48-50°. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?
Band Gap : 0.0 eV; Predicted Formation Energy : -0.148068191857141 eV/atom.
You are an expert in performance prediction for nitride materials.

Fe2N crystallizes in the hexagonal P-6m2 space group. The structure is two-dimensional and consists of one Fe2N sheet oriented in the (0, 0, 1) direction. Fe(1) is bonded in a 3-coordinate geometry to three equivalent N(1) atoms. All Fe(1)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.95 Å. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Fe(1) atoms to form distorted edge-sharing NFe6 pentagonal pyramids. What is the Band Gap and Predicted Formation Energy of this nitride material?

Fe4N crystallizes in the trigonal R-3m space group. There are two inequivalent Fe sites. In the first Fe site, Fe(1) is bonded to three equivalent Fe(2) and nine equivalent Fe(1) atoms to form FeFe12 cuboctahedra that share corners with six equivalent Fe(1)Fe12 cuboctahedra, corners with six equivalent N(1)Fe6 octahedra, edges with twelve equivalent Fe(1)Fe12 cuboctahedra, faces with twelve equivalent Fe(1)Fe12 cuboctahedra, and  a faceface with one N(1)Fe6 octahedra. The corner-sharing octahedral tilt angles are 42°. All Fe(1)-Fe(2) bond lengths are 2.53 Å. There are three shorter (2.44 Å) and six longer (2.58 Å) Fe(1)-Fe(1) bond lengths. In the second Fe site, Fe(2) is bonded in a 3-coordinate geometry to three equivalent Fe(1) and three equivalent N(1) atoms. All Fe(2)-N(1) bond lengths are 1.92 Å. N(1) is bonded to six equivalent Fe(2) atoms to form NFe6 octahedra that share corners with twelve equivalent Fe(1)Fe12 cuboctahedra, edges with six equivalent N(1)Fe6 octahedra, and faces with two equivalent Fe(1)Fe12 cuboctahedra.
